intro: Sagraea attenuata, commonly known as the slender sagraea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruits are small berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Sagraea attenuata is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
